page.title: 16DERELICT HOUSE
page.content: We saw a derelict house next door to the Dairy. It has been deserted for years. The dairy used to be in the village until it was moved out because the villagers didn't like the mess and smell. The orchard near the house was chosen for the new Farm buildings. It was so close the house was not saleable. The farmer only employs five men, three of them working on the arable. With so few men he does not need the cottages. The cottage is thatched but this is falling off in lumps. Birds bats and insects find it an ideal habitat. The walls are wattle and daub with gaping window holes in them. You can see the broken timbers through the window and door apertures. It is a haven for all forms of wildlife. Bats which are now protected live there in peace.
